Package ru.ashemchuk.game

Class Output

java.lang.Object
ru.ashemchuk.game.Output
public class Output extends Object
Handles all console output operations for the card game. Provides methods for displaying game state, player actions, and results.

  • Constructor Details

    • Output

      public Output()

  • Method Details

    • printRoundStart

      public void printRoundStart(Game game)
      Prints the round start announcement with the current round number.
      Parameters:
      game - the current game instance

    • printHand

      public void printHand(Player player)
      Prints a player's current hand of cards. Displays the player's title and the string representation of their hand.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose hand to display

    • printInputPrompt

      public void printInputPrompt()
      Prints the input prompt for the user's turn. Instructs the user to enter "1" to take a card or "0" to stop.

    • printMove

      public void printMove(Player player, Card card)
      Prints a player's move when they draw a card. Shows the drawn card and updates the display of the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      player - the player who made the move
      card - the card that was drawn

    • printTurn

      public void printTurn(Player player)
      Prints the turn announcement for a player. Includes visual separation for clarity.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose turn is starting

    • printBadInput

      public void printBadInput()
      Prints a warning message for invalid user input.

    • printWinner

      public void printWinner(Player p1, Player p2)
      Determines and prints the winner of the current round. Updates player scores based on the outcome according to blackjack rules: - Blackjack (21 points) wins automatically - Player with points over 21 loses - Higher point value wins if both are 21 or under - Draw if point values are equal
      Parameters:
      p1 - the first player (typically the user)
      p2 - the second player (typically the dealer)

    • printScores

      public void printScores(Player p1, Player p2)
      Prints the current scores of both players. Displays the score in the format: "Player1 Score1:Score2 Player2"
      Parameters:
      p1 - the first player
      p2 - the second player
